title: Data Analyst
description:
TruConnect is on a mission to bridge the digital divide in the United States by delivering premium wireless services to underserved communities. We have connected millions of Americans over the past decade and experiencing substantial growth as the government places significant resources to help bridge the digital divide.

The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, well-organized, creative, empathetic, and proactive. You build trust & strong relationships at all levels. You are confident and can influence without formal authority, pushing back when appropriate. You earn respect and respect contributions of others.

 




DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

Demonstrable experience of using relational databases and Cloud Data environments via writing performant queries in SQL against multi-terabyte and billion row datasets in AWS Redshift/Spectrum, MS SQL, and MySQL
Transform data-based observations and insights into hypotheses through analytical rigor, leading to use cases that will confirm or deny those hypotheses and ultimately improve the quality of data
Demonstrate critical thinking around business rules and logic especially as it pertains to compensation models and other analytic models
Design appropriate data structures by gathering data from primary and secondary sources for reporting consumption
Troubleshoot, research, and identify discrepancies specifically around data such as inventory, compensation, claims/reimbursements, general sales activity, and other such related data
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Create structured data marts for current and historical reporting
Detail oriented and deadline driven to meet monthly filing deadlines
Assist in data governance, meta data management and quality control of the completeness and accuracy of data
Work with end users to follow through with associated action items and execute in a timely manner
Design and document process and data flows for establishing data pipelines to support detailed analyses and accuracy in reporting
Present analyses, translate findings in the data into solutions, and perform root cause analysis in a concise manner which is easy to interpret and understand

 

 

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

Bachelor’s degree is required. A degree in economics, finance, computer science, statistics, or other data related field preferred
Experience working with ETL tools such as Matillion, AWS Glue, SSIS, etc.
Working knowledge of BI reporting tools such as Tableau or similar tools
Strong product development mindset and focus on actionable analytics
Ability to clearly communicate with cross functional teams
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Translate business requirements into technical requirements
Work with business stakeholders to assess potential risks
Minimum of 2 years of BI/reporting/data analysis experience
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills
Analyze problems and provide automated solutions whenever possible
Working knowledge and experience with Agile/Scrum methodology and iterative practices in a service delivery lifecycle
Experience with online collaboration tools such as Slack, JIRA, or MS Teams is a plus
Consistent demonstration of organization, prioritization, self-motivation, and problem resolution skills
Ability to navigate between multiple projects, meet deadlines, and process ad hoc requests
Ability to deal with ambiguity and influence change in a rapidly changing business environment
Great interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to provide insights to support key business decision making
MUST be able to work from the Los Angeles Office 3-4 days/week

 

BENEFITS:

401(k) matching
Medical insurance, including PPO & HSA
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Flexible Spending Account(s)
Free Life & Long-Term Disability Insurance
Free Identity Theft Protection & Travel Assistance
Access to corporate discount program
Flexible schedule
Paid time off (sick, bereavement, and Flex PTO)
Parental leave

 

Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
description:
Vous êtes passionné.e par la data ? Le comportement des consommateurs vous intrigue ?

Les données vous parlent et vous savez les faire parler afin d’améliorer la prise de décision ?

Alors postulez chez SIRIUS Insight et mettez vos compétences au profit d’entreprises issus du retail, de l’automobile, des banques et assurances, des pharmacies, des mutuelles, … Vos analyses et recommandations feront la différence pour leur développement.

 

L’entreprise et vos futurs collègues

SIRIUS Insight est une PME belge localisée à Louvain-la-Neuve et spécialisée dans la stratégie géomarketing. Nos clients font appel à nous pour croiser leurs données avec Dividuals®, pour bénéficier de nos conseils dans la définition du réseau de points de vente optimal, pour estimer les ventes futures, pour déterminer le risque de churn, pour vérifier l’impact de différents scénarios, ... L’équipe dont vous ferez partie est composée d’experts en géomarketing. Le respect, la prise d’initiative, l’entraide et la confiance sont les éléments clés qui conditionnent notre fonctionnement.

 

11 millions d’habitants et plus de 200.000 points de vente et de service : ce que vous ferez de ces données

Ces deux chiffres éveillent votre curiosité et votre besoin d’analyser ? Chez SIRIUS Insight ce sera votre mission : investiguer tout type de données, les croiser avec des données telles que Dividuals® et apporter du conseil. Qui est le client de l’entreprise ? Qui faut-il cibler ? Comment se comportent les clients/prospects ? Sur lesquels faut-il concentrer les efforts ? Où se situe le groupe cible ? Où faut-il investir dans de nouveaux points de vente ? C’est vous qui activerez les bons outils et données pour apporter des réponses à ces différentes questions.

 

Vos missions chez SIRIUS Insight seront particulièrement variées et vous pourrez compter sur une équipe d’experts pour vous soutenir.

Vous participez activement aux briefings des clients afin d’entendre leurs défis.
Vous aidez à déterminer la solution appropriée en regard du défi posé.
Vous êtes responsable de la réalisation des analyses suggérées et avez le support des collègues analystes.
Vous visualisez les informations de manière à ce qu’elles soient intelligibles et attractives. Vous créez cartes, graphes, rapports, présentations ou l’ensemble dans des tableaux de bords interactifs (PowerBI, Tableau, …)
Vous présentez vous-même aux clients vos observations et recommandations.
Vous détectez des opportunités intéressantes pour le développement du client.

 

Des aptitudes d’analyse et l’envie de s’améliorer en permanence : le profil que nous recherchons

Nous recherchons un/une collègue qui se projette facilement dans l’univers du client. Il/elle plonge dans diverses données et est en mesure de recommander au client les actions à mettre en place. Vous ne disposez pas de l’ensemble des compétences, mais vous n’avez pas peur d’approfondir vos connaissances ? Alors n’hésitez pas à postuler également.

 

Expérience et compétences métier

Vous avez un master orienté business (économie, gestion), un master scientifique ou une formation ou expérience équivalente.
Vous « parlez » ou avez des notions Python, R et SQL.
Vous maitrisez le français ou le néerlandais, et vous êtes capables de travailler dans l’autre langue et en anglais.
Vous disposez des bases techniques ou statistiques pour mener l’analyse de données.
Si vous avez un intérêt pour la modélisation et les nouvelles techniques d’intelligence artificielle, vous pourrez les mettre au profit des clients et développer davantage ces compétences.

 

Compétences personnelles

Vous avez d’excellentes compétences interpersonnelles.
Vous comprenez les besoins et les enjeux de vos interlocuteurs.
Vous êtes en mesure de vulgariser les méthodes et de recommander des actions.
Vous-êtes autonome tout en ayant un esprit d’équipe.
Vous êtes en mesure de planifier votre travail.
Vous remettez en question des pratiques et avez la capacité d’apprendre facilement de nouveaux outils, méthodes, langages, ...

 

Notre offre : un job varié, une équipe soudée et un fonctionnement « phygital »

Nous vous offrons un job impactant et varié que vous exercez en compagnie d’autres experts. Chez SIRIUS Insight, vous intégrez une équipe bienveillante à taille humaine. Vous aurez la possibilité de vous développer, de vous former, de prendre des initiatives et de manipuler des données uniques telles que notre segmentation des consommateurs Dividuals®. Nous vous offrons un cadre de travail flexible ou vous pourrez combiner le télétravail et le travail en nos bureaux situés à Louvain-la-Neuve. Vous bénéficiez d’un package salarial en adéquation avec vos compétences, complété d’avantages extra-légaux dont une voiture de société.

 

Faisons connaissance !

Vous lisez toujours cette offre d’emploi et êtes de plus en plus enthousiaste à l’idée de rejoindre notre équipe ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature et faisons connaissance.

Lors de l’entretien vous aurez la possibilité de poser toutes vos questions, présenter vos aspirations, découvrir l’entreprise et même de rencontrer vos futurs collègues.

Envoyez votre candidature par e-mail à Karolien Sottiaux - hr@siriusinsight.be

Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
description:
The Role




You will be a Data Analyst in the newly created Data & Analytics Center of Excellence of Industrial Air Division. In The Data & Analytics Center of Excellence, we have the vision to provide relevant, reliable, and relevant data insights to the right people across our division at the right time. We use the modern data stack built by CTIS (IT) and we specialize in the datamining of the datasets produced and consumed by Industrial Air.




Atlas Copco Industrial Air is one of the largest industrial equipment providers in the world. Our engagement with a diverse customer base and a vast product offering create a treasure of B2B data. As a Data Analyst you will spot opportunities for improvements in our strategic decision making and our business processes. You will work with different business experts from Marketing, Sales, Finance and HR and you will be on a mission to develop a data-driven approach in the way we do business. By applying the power of data and the latest analytical technologies, you make sure we maintain our leading position in each market and segment we compete in.




Responsibilities




You will develop a deep understanding of your data domain. You become an expert in the 4Vs (Volume, Variety, Velocity, Veracity) of the data assets utilized by our operational and business apps.
You understand our customers' needs and the value chain of our business processes.
You define and execute end-to-end analytical initiatives. You unlock exceptional business performance by providing previously unknown and potentially actionable insights to your business stakeholders.
You will guide Data Engineers in creating the ETL pipelines that serve your analysis.
You will critically select the data modelling techniques that serve the purpose. You are comfortable with techniques like Frequent Pattern Analysis, Classification, Regression, Clustering, Anomaly detection, Trend and Evolution Analysis.
You will evaluate the identified patterns from various angles and with various metrics (accuracy, error rate, ROC curve, etc.)
You know that analysis and modelling are only half of the job. You are an excellent presenter of your results. You adapt the message to your audience, you know how to choose an effective visual and you follow storytelling principles.
Where needed, you crystallize your results in standard reports and dashboards. You will guide Power BI developers in creating visualization solutions or integrating new elements in existing ones.




What we expect of you?




MSc in Data Analytics or MSc in Business and Economics with a focus on data analytics.
You are competent with Data Exploration tools (SQL, Excel, Pandas).
You are competent with Data Visualization tools (Power BI) or Data Visualization libraries (Matplotlib, Seaborn).
Experience with statistical analysis in R or Python.
Experience with Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Databricks (Spark), SAP BW and Microsoft Purview is a plus.
You have a strong analytical mindset and an eye for detail.
You communicate and collaborate effectively with a diverse group of business and IT stakeholders.
Strong customer focus, you establish good relationships with your internal customers, you care about their success.
You challenge the status-quo, you champion a data-driven approach across all functions and levels of the organization.
You are passionate about the Data & Analytics field, and you stay on top of your game by following the latest trends through seminars, workshops, and conferences.




Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice




Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.
Show more Show less

  • You are passionate about the Data & Analytics field, and you stay on top of your game by following the latest trends through seminars, workshops, and conferences.


Diverse by nature and inclusive by choice


Bright ideas come from all of us. The more unique perspectives we embrace, the more innovative we are. Together we build a culture where difference is valued and we share a deep sense of purpose and belonging.

title: Data Analyst
description_html:
Do you want to work at a company with real social impact? On top of that you value a healthy work-life balance? Say no more! I have THE right place for you ;)


The Data Analyst takes ownership of the monitoring and reporting of the systems installed with our customers. They ensure that the client systems are in good working order, data trends are clear, and that business can be steered according to the data we manage. They propose improvements and develop process and procedures that continuously improve the level of service.


Your tasks


  • Ensure data collection, integrity and consistency;
  • Transform data into information: propose and develop dashboards and analysis that help supporting production and continuous improvement;
  • Ensure monitoring of the production systems;
  • Define, implement and maintain dashboards and monitoring/reporting tools ;
  • Analyse events and issues, resolve them and support clients in that process ;
  • Feed back and contribute to the improvement of the solution from an incident and customer support point-of-view ;
  • Contribute to the deployments of new clients and solutions by creating and deploying new systems and tools;


Your profile


  • University degree in science, engineering, economics or management;
  • Experience with data monitoring and analysis; ability to structure and present data;
  • Knowledge of relational DBs / SQL;
  • Python and ML are an asset;
  • You speak French/Dutch and English;


We're offering


  • A fixed contract within a high-growth scale-up;
  • The opportunity to grow within the role and the company;
  • Plenty of opportunity to learn.
  • A competitive salary supplemented with extra legal benefits (hospitalization insurance, group insurance, company car, teleworking, etc.).
  • Diversity & inclusion - We are passionate about the inclusion and support of individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.


Want to know more?

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
Business Data Analyst ⚡

European Union




Our client is a world-leading luxury marketplace. They serve high-net-worth individuals in some of their most important transactions. These transactions include luxury real estate, luxury cars, yachts, private jets, and hard-to-find luxury watches, among other high-priced items. With over a million users spread across countries like the United States, UK, France, and Germany, they have a constant catalog of over 200,000 listings. They are in a phase of rapid growth, thanks to strong investors, and are looking for a Business Data Analyst to join them remotely in this phase.




Responsibilities:




Working with internal teams and data to provide visibility into their business functions, activity, trends and performance.
Working closely with their engineering team to establish and communicate data transformation and storage needs.
Partnering with their business leaders to develop and execute projects to help accelerate business growth and improve processes.
Compiling data from different tables in their DWH, preparing the data for analysis, visualising in Tableau dashboards, and feed insights to other business functions.

Requirements:




5+ years of experience in analytical positions
Strong analytics conceptual and problem-solving abilities
Fluent in English
Proficient in – SQL, Tableau, Python and DQuery

Why Apply?




Global work environment and international team
Competitive compensation plus equity
Work from anywhere and flexible working
Opportunity to work with CTO
Unlimited holiday




🌎 European Union - Remote

title: Data Analyst
description:
Als Data Analyst bij Ordina help je onze klanten bij het oplossen van complexe data-vraagstukken. Je verzamelt gegevens van verschillende bronnen, optimaliseert datasets voor visualisatie en ontwikkelt inzichtelijke en gebruiksvriendelijke dashboards. Jij bent de brug tussen business en IT.

In je takenpakket zit onder anderen het verlenen van diensten op het gebied van data-analyse en process mining om klanten te helpen bedrijfsproblemen op te lossen, waarde te creëren en strategie en inzicht te verkrijgen uit gegevens. Je geeft mee vorm aan oplossingen die de klanten helpen om data gedreven beslissingen te nemen en zakelijke uitdagingen te helpen oplossen. Zo draag je ertoe bij dat onze klanten klaar zijn voor de uitdagingen van de toekomst en dus ‘ahead of change zijn’. Met behulp van je eigen expertise en de Ordina design-thinking methodologie verhoog je de kwaliteit van de analyses en visualisaties bij onze klanten. Daarnaast draagt je input bij aan de visie en ontwikkeling van onze unit.

Wie we zoeken


Je bent gepassioneerd door data, data storytelling en business processen
Analyseren en oplossingen bedenken in co-creatie met business stakeholders, zijn je absolute sterktes
Je hebt een grondige kennis van SQL en minimum één visualisatie tool zoals Power BI, Tableau of Qlik Sense; je kan dit aantonen aan de hand van je portfolio of door certificatie
Kennis van python en web technologie (D3.js, React, etc.) is een pluspunt
Je hebt een probleemoplossend vermogen
Samen met je collega’s successen boeken motiveert je
Een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale instelling is wat we zoeken
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden, klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn ook een must
Je past je makkelijk aan wanneer een situatie wijzigt en blijft gefocust op het beste resultaat behalen


Wat we bieden


Je bent een sleutelfiguur in projecten bij Belgische topbedrijven
Je werkt in een hightech omgeving met de focus op kennis en innovatie
Je kennis blijft up-to-date dankzij workshops, conferenties, trainingen en je wordt voortdurend door je collega’s
Een gezonde balans tussen werk en privéleven
Je kan mee richting geven aan je carrière en blijven groeien
Je collega’s zijn down to earth en hebben een no-nonsense houding, er is ruimte voor eigen initiatief
Je kan deelnemen aan leuke business- en teambuildingsactiviteiten
Je geniet van voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, laptop, gsm-vergoeding, maaltijdcheques, verzekering etc.
Je kan je netto salaris optimaliseren dankzij onze IP-reward
Je kan de volgende DataViz-Wizard worden in ons team. Wie wil er nu geen wizard zijn?
Dit jaar gaan we de kaap van 40 wizards doorbreken, ben jij nummer 40? Dan win je een mooie prijs!


Iedereen is welkom om te solliciteren. Want we geloven in de kracht van diversiteit en hechten veel waarde aan inclusie. De beste ideeën en slimste oplossingen ontstaan immers in diverse teams. Precies daarom besteden we zoveel aandacht aan de samenstelling van onze high performance teams. Zodat jij je op je plek voelt en het beste uit jezelf kan halen.
Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet

Who We Are

Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.

Job Role

We are now looking for a Data Analyst with expertise in predictive and prescriptive analytics to join our Product department and to help drive innovation and decisions in our products.

As a Data Analyst, you will perform in-depth analysis and visualization datasets, to drive decisions with the Product Managers and Product Leads in the area that you will cover. You will play a key role by working closely with the business to identify the use cases, where external or internal data insights can make an impact and improve business decision-making. This is a unique opportunity to leverage academic and professional experience in publishing, statistics and data analytics to increase the quality of published science, maximize the efficiency of the publishing process and make peer-review more objective.

Key Responsibilities

Contribute to different initiatives involving descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analysis by leveraging a variety of statistical techniques
Provide analysis of trends and forecasts and recommend actions for optimization
Identify patterns, build models, test, and improve predictive algorithms that increase our understanding of customer trends and identify opportunities to improve our products and services
Work together with product managers, data scientists and business stakeholders to understand and support their needs
Proactively identify opportunities for improvements in data quality, data visualization and data reporting for Digital Products


About You

Degree in a quantitative field, such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Analytics, or other related fields with advanced coursework in statistics
Experience with statistical modelling techniques (e.g. linear regression, logistic regression, GLM), forecasting and predictive modelling
Working knowledge in one or more statistical programming languages (e.g. SAS, Python, or R)
Experience querying operational Databases to complement lack of data in the official datasources
Experience with Google Analytics and similar tools
Experience with data visualization and graphics tools such as Tableau for the creation of reports and dashboards is a plus
Familiarity with big data platforms (e.g. BigQuery, Spark, Databricks) is a plus
Robust analytical, critical thinking, and creative problem solving skills
Accustomed to fast-paced environments with simultaneous, high-priority tasks
Solid written and verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences (fluency in English is a must)


Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes:

100% remote working

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).

Learning and development

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.

Wellbeing

We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Volunteering opportunities

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination – including based on race, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations, our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.
Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to work for us remotely

Job Requirements

3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 3 areas in the context of Artificial Intelligence (or Machine Learning or Data Science or Data Analytics) projects:
Data Analysis
Business Requirements Gathering
Project Management.
3-5 years of professional experience in each of the following 2 areas:
Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (R-RStudio, Python-Anaconda or Knime);
Dashboarding and Data Analytics (Power BI or SAP Analytics Cloud)
Minimum 3-5 years of professional cumulative experience in the following 4 areas (with a minimum of 1 year professional experience per area):
Database development, Data Modelling and SQL (Oracle RDMBS or SQL Server);
ETL tools (BODI or BODS would be an asset);
Business Objects
Data Warehouse

Due to the particular nature of the client, candidates should also have the following non-technical skills:

Capability of integration in an international/multicultural environment, rapid self-starting capability and experience in working in team;
Ability to participate in multilingual meetings;
Ability to work in multi-cultural environment, on multiple large projects;
Excellent Team Player
High degree of discretion and integrity is required

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to pick up and deliver new data driven cases by analysing the requirements and data involved.

The goal of the project is to build a new IT Data Lake on AWS with IT related data feeds, both batch and online and the exploitation of that data with automated reports and AI cases to support the IT organization and its processes.

What skills do you need to meet the requirements of our team?


You are capable to define qualitative data selections queries based upon the requirements
You are used to join in with the feasibility study to determine what data the company need, define the work to be done and by whom
You will be the guard quality of the data and verify the integrity, think ahead to define possible issues
You have a good knowledge of GDPR and how to deal with it in a data driven context


What functions will help you advance?


You have at least 3 year experience in (big) Data Projects
You have data analysis, data definitions and data modelling skills
You have knowledge of the Agile method with Safe
You have a strong written and verbal communication, who can listen and understand
You are a real team player: who like helping and coaching
Having an Experience with IT processes regarding development, operations or security is an asset.


Does this sound like a challenge for you? Then don't hesitate to apply and join our team!

title: Clinical Data Analyst
description:
AIXIAL is an International Contract Research Organization (CRO), a member of the ALTEN Group, providing complex services in clinical trials (phase I-IV) and non-interventional studies. Our offices are located in France, Belgium, Switzerland, Germany and Czech Republic.




We are currently looking for a Clinical Data Analyst.




Your responsabilities will include (but are not limited to):

Contribute to the development of visualization and reporting to support the clinical trial activities (medical safety review, analytical risk-based monitoring, data review, etc)
Creating reports using the clinical data and partnerign with Clinical Teams and stakeholders
Participate in the optimization of user management, content management, performance management and lifecycle management related to reporting and metrics
Takes a leadership role with development and delivery of reports, templates and metrics and related activities




Desirable Work Experience, Qualifications and Knowledge:




Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science or Computer Science
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst working within Data Warehouse platforms and BI tools in a regulated industry within a clinical trial environment
Strong knowledge of Python, R, SAS and similar scripting languages is preferred
Knowledge of SDTM data structure
SQL knowledge
Knowledge of Tibco Spotfire (preferred) or similar BI software tool (Tableau, QlikView, Microsoft Power BI,..)
Experience in pharmaceutical & life sciences industry is preferred
Good planning, organizational and project management skills.
Ability to prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
Good communication skills




Langage skills:

Strong level in English would be required

title: Data-analist
company: if-ic (Instituut Functieclassificatie - Institut de Classification de fonctions)
description_html:
Wie zijn wij?

IFIC (Instituut voor Functieclassificatie) is een paritaire beheerde organisatie die moderne en innovatieve functieclassificaties en loonmodellen ontwikkelt voor de non-profitsectoren - voornamelijk voor de gezondheidszorg. Ons enthousiaste team bestaat uit consultants, economen/data-analisten evenals de staff en directie.


Dataverwerker

Gecontroleerde en kwaliteitsvolle gegevens vormen de noodzakelijke basis voor onderbouwde analyses en betrouwbare kostenramingen. Als dataverwerker sta je voornamelijk in voor de kwaliteitscontrole, volledigheid en coherentie van gegevens aangeleverd door de instellingen van de non-profitsector in het kader van loonstudies of financieringsrapporten die de impact van de uitwerking van een nieuwe sectorale functieclassificatie moeten evalueren.


Meer bepaald help je de instellingen bij het invullen van het Exceldocument voor de rapportering van loongegevens/financieringen, volgens duidelijke instructies door te antwoorden op hun vragen. Je bent ook verantwoordelijk voor de kwaliteitscontrole van de gerapporteerde gegevens en je contacteert organisaties om bijkomende informatie te bekomen wanneer dit noodzakelijk is. Je rapporteert regelmatig de stand van zaken aan het team van data-analisten.


Profiel

  • Je bent georganiseerd, nauwkeurig en beschikt over een kritische geest;
  • Je kan vlot omgaan met Excel;
  • Je kan zowel mondeling als schriftelijk vlot communiceren;
  • Je hebt geen schrik om vragen te stellen;
  • Je bent Nederlands- of Franstalig, met een goede kennis van de andere taal;
  • Je bent stressbestendig;
  • Kennis van loongegevens is een bijkomende troef.


Meer info?

Aarzel niet om onze website te raadplegen en ons aanbod te ontdekken https://www.if-ic.org/nl/dataverwerker/aanbod of een belletje naar 02 540 80 58

title: PowerBI Data Analyst
description:
Ben je gepassioneerd door data & analyse en krijg jij energie van het bouwen van PowerBI dashboards met oog voor design die relevante informatie helder voorstellen? Werk je bovendien graag mee aan de meest innovatieve data oplossingen van de toekomst? Laten we dan eens sparren over een positie als Power BI Data Analyst in ons Data Solutions team.

In je rol als PowerBI Data Analyst werk je nauw samen met ervaren collega’s aan Business Intelligence, Big Data en AI-projecten.
Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie door gebruiksvriendelijke Power BI dashboards te ontwikkelen.
Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.
Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.


Wat breng jij mee?

Je hebt een aanstekelijk enthousiasme over data & business intelligence.
Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring opgebouwd als Data Analyst en Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen meer.
Kennis van technologie in data engineering en datawarehouses is een plus. Ook kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python is een meerwaarde.
Je bouwt impactvolle dashboards als geen ander én je haalt energie uit storytelling.
Je brengt een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale houding met je mee.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden, klantgerichtheid en nauwkeurigheid zijn tevens zeer belangrijk in deze rol.
Een bepaalde flexibiliteit naar verplaatsingen is vereist aangezien er regelmatig van bij de klant wordt gewerkt. Als je aanwezigheid bij de klant niet vereist is dan kan je in het Cegeka-kantoor dichtst bij je woonplaats werken (Antwerpen, Gent, Hasselt of Leuven) of van thuis uit.


Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?

We vragen heel wat (talenten) van jou. Gelukkig krijg je er ook heel wat voor terug! Een krak zoals jij verdient immers het allerbeste!
Competenties en karakter zijn voor ons essentieel, naast ervaring en ambities. Cegeka investeert voortdurend in talent management opdat elke medewerker zijn potentieel kan realiseren.
Innovatie en kennisdeling staan bij ons hoog op de agenda. We zijn altijd op zoek naar vernieuwing en verbetering bij onze klanten. Je krijgt volop kansen om hierin actief deel te nemen.
Je komt terecht in een hecht, gedreven en gepassioneerd team waarin het aangenaam én leuk werken is. We hebben zelfs een eigen Data Solutions fun team.
Begeleiding op maat! Jij geeft aan waar je interesses liggen. We bieden verschillende carrièrepaden aan, en kijken samen hoe we je verder kunnen helpen ontplooien.
Naast het competitief brutosalaris, een (elektrische) bedrijfswagen of mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, gsm-abonnement, forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding en krachtige laptop, bieden we jou flexibele werkuren en een mooie work/life balans.
Dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan kunnen we een verloning op maat aanbieden.

title: Data Analyst - Process
description:
SGK is a global packaging and brand experience company. From idea to implementation, we deliver packaging solutions and brand experiences that give brands the freedom to speak louder, scale faster and grow stronger. We simplify marketing and amplify brands to deliver value. SGK is a Matthews International company.




Role Summary




We are recruiting for a Data Analyst to join our team on a 12 months fixed term contract basis. This role can be worked on a hybrid basis from any of our EMEA locations.




Working closely with our client you will be responsible for analysing multiple sources of data, manipulating this data to turn into KPIs, developing dashboards and translating complex data into functional tools. You will also use this analysis to come up with tools to further improve internal company processes.




Responsibilities




Develops processes and workflows to standardize multiple processes.
Develops tools and documents for data collection as well as enhances and streamlines the analysis process and standards.
Obtains related information to upload in various databases.
Gathers and compiles accurate data for reports and completes data analysis for material requirements and capacity planning.
Prepares reports and documents clearly summarizing the results of data analysis.
Collaborates with various stakeholders to provide plans to meet expected service levels for all services.
Analyses and maintains data collected.
Leads projects as assigned.
Additional duties as assigned.




Qualifications/Skills




High degree of proficiency in Excel, MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications
Able to translate complicated formulas into readable, presentable data to be shared with multiple stakeholders
Strong analytical, verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning)
Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts
Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients
Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment.
Ability to work with and influence peers and senior management
Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting




Matthews International endeavors to make our employment website and application process accessible to all users and applicants. In doing so, Matthews International provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you have a disability and require a reasonable accommodation or assistance completing the application process, please contact a member of our Human Resource Team.




At Matthews International, what makes us different is what makes us great. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: Data Analyst
description:
DE JOB

Meten is weten! Digitalisatie vormt één van de hefbomen van het strategisch plan van Infrabel en dankzij onze geleidelijke digitalisatie hebben we vandaag al veel gegevens. Als Data Analyst help je onze organisatie deze data te vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten, bijvoorbeeld met krachtige visualisaties in een PowerBI dashboard.

Je speelt als Data Analyst een sleutelrol in het team van Asset & Business Performance waarin je:

geen schrik hebt data uit verschillende bronnen (SAP PM, excel, csv, xml, sql) te analyseren naar aanleiding van bepaalde problemen.
nauw samenwerkt en in interactie gaat met heel wat verschillende gesprekspartners binnen Infrabel om waardevolle data te identificeren en zo de juiste indicatoren naar voor te schuiven.
verschillende databronnen verwerkt en vertaalt naar krachtige visualisaties in PowerBI.
de kosten visualiseert en de rationaliseringsmogelijkheden in verschillende afdelingen analyseert.
mee nadenkt over wat je uit de gegevens kunt leren en hieruit verbetervoorstellen formuleert.
een onderscheid maakt tussen wat relevant is voor de organisatie.
Initiatieven neemt om de gegevenskwaliteit te verbeteren in samenwerking met de eigenaars van de data.
af en toe op het veld gaat om betrokken zijn bij het verzamelen van de data.

JOUW PROFIEL

Je hebt een masterdiploma (ingenieur, wiskunde, IT, statistiek…) dat relevant is voor de functie.
Of een bachelor in ICT met relevante werkervaring in de sector.
Je weet businessvraagstukken te vertalen naar een data-analyse en bijhorende rapportering.
Je hebt een uitgesproken interesse in IT/ICT, waaronder een basiskennis in programmatie (SQL).
Je beschikt reeds over ervaring met tools voor datavisualisatie zoals Qlikview, Tableau of PowerBI.
Kennis van of interesse in SAP PM is een pluspunt.
Je spreekt en schrijft vloeiend Frans of Nederlands en durft je uitdrukken in de tweede landstaal.
Je hebt uitstekende relationele en communicatieve vaardigheden.
Je beschikt over een analytische geest en oog voor detail.
Je kan makkelijke de silo’s doorbreken en timmert dagelijks aan een transversale samenwerking.
Je bent een echte ambassadeur voor de “Future Operations” afdeling en je kan mensen meenemen.
Je bent een leider op jouw gebied en toont empathie in jouw omgang met anderen.
Je werkt graag in teamverband.
Je kan je aanpassen aan verschillende situaties en ziet verandering als een kans.

Infrabel wil de maatschappelijke diversiteit weerspiegeld zien in haar medewerkers. Jouw talenten en enthousiasme, daar draait het om, niet om je geslacht, leeftijd, origine of beperking.

ONS AANBOD

Een boeiende en afwisselende job
Bij een stabiel bedrijf dat bijdraagt aan een duurzame mobiliteit voor de samenleving
Talrijke opleidings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden: jij bent ondernemer van je eigen carrière
Veel flexibiliteit, zodat je zelf de balans tussen werk en privé kan bepalen
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met verschillende aanvullende voordelen
Gratis reizen met de trein

DE WERKOMGEVING

Infrabel bouwt, onderhoudt en vernieuwt de spoorweginfrastructuur in België. Met zo’n 10.000 medewerkers werken we aan een betrouwbaar en modern spoorwegnet: om de mobiliteitsbehoeften van onze samenleving mee te ontwikkelen en bij te dragen aan een duurzame samenleving.

De doelstellingen van de afdeling “Future Operations” zijn de volgende :

De organisatie voorzien van statistieken en analyse-instrumenten om de doeltreffendheid en de efficiëntie te controleren en deze waar nodig te analyseren en aan te passen.

Wij willen de gegevensverwerking zoveel mogelijk automatiseren.

WELKE STAPPEN DOORLOOP JE?

Solliciteer online > cv-screening > Wij nemen contact met je op > Selectiegesprek > Welkom bij Infrabel!

Heb je een beperking en kunnen redelijke aanpassingen je een vlotte sollicitatie ervaring garanderen? Laat het ons dan weten.

VRAGEN OVER DEZE VACATURE?

Ludovic Myttenaere | Talent Acquisition Specialist | Tel: +32 2 432 57 89| E-mail: ludovic.myttenaere@infrabel.be

Vergeet niet een profiel aan te maken via “Mijn Profiel”. Je kan er niet alleen je gegevens aanvullen, maar ook “job alerts” aanmaken volgens jouw interesses. Zo krijg je de nieuwe jobs die bij jou passen als eerste in je mailbox.

title: Junior Data Analist - Regio Mechelen
description:
Beschrijving onderneming




Geïnteresseerd in onderstaande vacature? Laat je gegevens achter of benader me rechtstreeks via i.rottier@madison.be of +32 498 76 11 66.




Voor onze klant, een wereldwijde leverancier van professionele informatie en softwareoplossingen, zijn we momenteel op zoek naar een Data Analist die hun team te Mechelen kan versterken.




Takenpakket:




Je begeleidt collega’s van alle afdelingen met relevante en impactvolle datagedreven inzichten en acties.
Je zorgt ervoor dat de organisatie meer datagedreven wordt, in nauwe samenwerking met de business.
Je biedt relevante datagedreven inzichten obv data analyses, gebruikmakende van visualisatie tools zoals Tableau en Qlik.
Je begrijpt wat de business nodig heeft en weet dit te vertalen naar acties die zij nodig hebben om hun doelen te bereiken.
Je denkt mee na over de juiste oplossingen in functie van de behoeften en noden van verscheidene departementen zoals marketing, sales, content & product development,...




Profiel:




Je behaalde een Bachelor of Master in een economische of IT gerelateerde richting.
Een eerste ervaring is mooi meegenomen, maar geen must.
Kennis van Tableau of Qlik is een plus.
Je bent analytisch en communicatief ingesteld.
Uitstekende kennis van Nederlands en Engels is vereist. Kennis van Frans is een plus.




Aanbod:

Bovenop een (meer dan) competitief salaris kan je ook een uitgebreid pakket aan extralegale voordelen verwachten. Denk hierbij aan:




Maaltijdcheques
Groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering
Ecocheques
Benefits for work (korting bij verschillende bedrijven)
Een uitgetekend groeiplan met verschillende opleidingen
Thuiswerk
36 vakantiedagen

title: Data Analyst - Consultant Financial Services (min 2 years of experience)
description:
Data Analyst - Consultant Financial Services (min 2 years of experience)




Initio is looking for experienced Team Members to hop on board our Data practice!




Are you eager to develop your skills to the next level? Do you want to be the next Initio talent?

Seize the opportunity to be part of a team driven by professionals and join Initio!




Initio is a fast-growing consulting firm that represents the best of both worlds - a Belgian human-size company with a team of 80 highly qualified consultants, part of the square group of over 800 professionals.




Your role:

We are looking for individuals with a strong sense of purpose and ownership. This means that

you will be proactive, quickly adapt to changing situations and create value for both Initio and our amazing clients:

During your assignments, you will help implement impactful changes and apply the best-practice methodology to ensure sustainable, innovative, and high-performance business transformations.
Internally, as a member of our Data Practice, you will be involved in research, white papers, training, and new offers development. This will allow you to broaden your competencies and build up knowledge whilst exchanging with your colleagues in an international and open environment.







Examples of projects in which you can be involved with:




Data governance & strategy:

Identify and prioritize critical data assets and develop and maintain planning, oversight, and control procedures and policies.
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualization, quality data, and dedicated datasets
Structure and leverage our client’s data to improve and strengthen their business




Data management:

Establish the Data organizational framework (data governance, data quality, data traceability, data control)
Control the regulatory (GDPR) and security framework (cyber risk, reputation risk, etc.)




Data science & analytics:

Formalize the internal service offers: data visualization, segmentation, automation of business processes
Be involved in data science projects involving machine learning, data marketing, and customer insight.
Participate in statistical modeling: scoring, logistic regression, backtesting, stress testing




Are you the one?

You have a Master’s degree in any relevant field (Business, Economics, Law, Actuary, Data...)
You have at least 2 years in data strategy, data governance, data management, data analytics & data science.
Following technical skills is a plus: SAS, SQL, SAP, VBA, R, Power BI, Tableau, Python,..
Client & customer-oriented, you understand the needs and expectations of the stakeholders
You have strong curiosity, analysis, oral and written communication skills
Any additional business or project management certifications are a plus
You speak native French or Dutch and are fluent in English




We offer:

A great working environment where work-life balance, informal work vibe, and open communication are essentials
An attractive and competitive package (e.g. car, laptop, mobile phone, meal vouchers, training programs, eco cheques...)
A great opportunity for personal and professional growth: exciting assignments for well-known clients in the financial sector; a specific training program, tailored to your needs; sharing your knowledge by coaching your fellow colleagues, and the internal role that encourages intrapreneurship and collective intelligence!
A career path in line with your ambitions and experience. Your responsibilities will vary according to your grade (Consultant, Senior Consultant, Manager, Senior Manager, Principal, Associate Partner)
…and a lot of FUN!
Show more Show less
description_html:
Data Analyst - Consultant Financial Services (min 2 years of experience)


Initio is looking for experienced Team Members to hop on board our Data practice!


Are you eager to develop your skills to the next level? Do you want to be the next Initio talent?

Seize the opportunity to be part of a team driven by professionals and join Initio!


Initio is a fast-growing consulting firm that represents the best of both worlds - a Belgian human-size company with a team of 80 highly qualified consultants, part of the square group of over 800 professionals.


Your role:

We are looking for individuals with a strong sense of purpose and ownership. This means that

you will be proactive, quickly adapt to changing situations and create value for both Initio and our amazing clients:

  • During your assignments, you will help implement impactful changes and apply the best-practice methodology to ensure sustainable, innovative, and high-performance business transformations.
  • Internally, as a member of our Data Practice, you will be involved in research, white papers, training, and new offers development. This will allow you to broaden your competencies and build up knowledge whilst exchanging with your colleagues in an international and open environment.



Examples of projects in which you can be involved with:


Data governance & strategy:

  • Identify and prioritize critical data assets and develop and maintain planning, oversight, and control procedures and policies.
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualization, quality data, and dedicated datasets
  • Structure and leverage our client’s data to improve and strengthen their business


Data management:

  • Establish the Data organizational framework (data governance, data quality, data traceability, data control)
  • Control the regulatory (GDPR) and security framework (cyber risk, reputation risk, etc.)


Data science & analytics:

  • Formalize the internal service offers: data visualization, segmentation, automation of business processes
  • Be involved in data science projects involving machine learning, data marketing, and customer insight.
  • Participate in statistical modeling: scoring, logistic regression, backtesting, stress testing


Are you the one?

  • You have a Master’s degree in any relevant field (Business, Economics, Law, Actuary, Data...)
  • You have at least 2 years in data strategy, data governance, data management, data analytics & data science.
  • Following technical skills is a plus: SAS, SQL, SAP, VBA, R, Power BI, Tableau, Python,..
  • Client & customer-oriented, you understand the needs and expectations of the stakeholders
  • You have strong curiosity, analysis, oral and written communication skills
  • Any additional business or project management certifications are a plus
  • You speak native French or Dutch and are fluent in English


We offer:

  • A great working environment where work-life balance, informal work vibe, and open communication are essentials
  • An attractive and competitive package (e.g. car, laptop, mobile phone, meal vouchers, training programs, eco cheques...)
  • A great opportunity for personal and professional growth: exciting assignments for well-known clients in the financial sector; a specific training program, tailored to your needs; sharing your knowledge by coaching your fellow colleagues, and the internal role that encourages intrapreneurship and collective intelligence!
  • A career path in line with your ambitions and experience. Your responsibilities will vary according to your grade (Consultant, Senior Consultant, Manager, Senior Manager, Principal, Associate Partner)
  • …and a lot of FUN!

title: Real time data analyst with Customer at heart
description:
About The Role




Do you love finding the missing pieces of the puzzle in a swimming pool full of data!




Do you want to use your drive to make the life of customer better, easier and happier?




You are truly passionate about making things better for our customers. You like to use your creativity and data expertise to find friction points and solve them with data. You are curious and explore how real time data can bring us new insights to make the employee or customer experience better.




You like to translate Business requirements and answer business use cases with real time data insights. You enjoy working with different people in different areas of the company to achieve (Customer) success together.




You are truly getting excited about using data to speak for the customers and help the organisation to make the right decisions in a real time fashion!




What to expect




You will work in the awesome Voice of the Customer team with creative and talented individuals from all parts of the world. Your team is spread out over multiple locations and the stakeholders you work with are global, allowing you the opportunity to truly work in an international environment.




The team itself has the unique position of being able to bring the customer’s voice towards the organization by using the customer and the data speak for itself. This consists of using data from direct feedback (what the customer tells us) and to combine this with indirect (what they say about us) and inferred (what the systems show us). Especially on the inferred part you will be active in looking at real-time data from our customers!




In this role you will be able to:




Shine bright like a diamond, by showing how data can speak for itself (if brought together in the right way)
Define data analysis use cases together with stakeholders within the whole organisation
Prepare data insights to be used and linked to the customer journey insights
Link real time data to the digital experience of the customer and the self service experience to drive actions to improve
Drive consumption of the operational and real time data
be an ambassador for our Customers and Customer Experience and have an eye on how to reduce frictions
Be your full self in an environment which promotes diversity and inclusion.
Explore new innovations and evolutions, stay aware of business trends and developments in the Customer autonomy space and see how they can contribute to our ambitions.
Launch yourself into training to further expand your skillset
// WORK/Train business analysts/champions/users
Learn the underlying flows and data structures that support SWIFT’s and customer’s business.





What will make you successful?




We are seeking professionals with extensive experience in the following:




Min. 3 of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
University degree or equivalent


Able to listen to stakeholders to concisely capture and document business requirements and use cases
Knowledge of:
SQL, Hadoop, Kafka
Data visualisation tools: Kibana, Tableau
Programming language Python, R
Understanding of data structures, data bases
Knowledge of SWIFT main message flows and related data structures is a big plus (support, prof services, platform & operations…)
OASIS knowledge is a plus
Data science skills are a nice to have


Soft skills:

Collaborative mindset on achieving results that matter for our customers
High drive to make things better for our employees and customers
Innovative and creative mindset
Strong English communication and networking skills (both written and oral)
Planning and organising (leading a project to a successful end)
Take accountability for delivering results
Adaptability and responsiveness to change
Passionate about data analysis, data engineering and science.
Excellent analytics skills on large data sets and have the ability to synthesis into key findings
Learning!!


About SWIFT

SWIFT is constantly evolving and innovating. Working at the intersection of finance and technology is a very exciting place to be right now.

SWIFT is transforming cross-border payments, making them faster and more transparent than ever before. We are the way the world moves value — every instant of every day, in almost every country.

We are proud that what we do has a critical impact on the global financial community and touches almost every aspect of the financial world. So, what you do at SWIFT has real impact too — an impact that matters every day. Which is why you matter to us.

Joining SWIFT gives you unparalleled exposure to knowledge, expertise and technologies. If you have what it takes, you’ll be able to take on different career paths and have the opportunity to work in teams, departments and disciplines in countries around the world.

SWIFT is unique. There is no other organisation like ours in the world driving the long-term future of the financial ecosystem. You’ll be surrounded by bright, customer-focused and intellectually curious people in a collaborative, friendly, open and inclusive environment.

At SWIFT we are trusted every instant. Everything we do has an impact that matters. And as a member of our team, you are trusted to make your impact every day.

What We Offer

We put you in control of career
We give you a competitive package
We help you perform at your best
We help you make a difference
We give you the freedom to be yourself

We give you the freedom to be yourself. We are creating an environment of unique individuals – like you – with different perspectives on the financial industry and the world. An environment in which everyone’s voice counts and where you can reach your full potential regardless of age, background, culture, colour, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion, sexual orientation, or veteran/military status.
Show more Show less

title: Internship in Data Analytics
description:
Line of Service

Assurance

Industry/Sector

Technology

Specialism

Assurance

Management Level

Intern/Trainee

Job Description & Summary

We guide. We support. You grow.

Want to help build trust in society? As a part of PwC Assurance, you’ll provide decision makers with the information they need to achieve better governance, transparency and accountability. Join our multidisciplinary team that uses cutting-edge technologies to make a difference for our clients and our communities, both at home and across the globe.

Fascinated by numbers the tech side of business? Want to work on various missions and turn business data into meaningful intelligence? Data’s a key source of value creation, yet companies are struggling to use it to impact their projects and their business. The fast-paced audit environment’s no exception, so PwC’s Data Analytics team is helping auditors use data in meaningful ways.

We’re looking for a talented Intern to join our Data Analytics team supporting the Assurance department as part of our Financial Audit team.

What you’ll learn and do

As an intern, you’ll be involved in a wide variety of tasks:


Analyse and transform source files
Automate manual processes to improve efficiency
Link and visualise datasets into dashboards
Support clients in analysis of key business drivers
Play with tools like Alteryx, PowerBI and Tableau
Basic coding in R and Python
Explore new solutions and ideas for advanced analysis


Who you are


Specialisation or an interest in data analytics/data science
Interest in deep business understanding
Knowledge in at least one of the following software platforms: Tableau, Spotfire, Alteryx, R, Python, Power BI
Team player with a sense of initiative and a critical, analytical mind
Communicative, eager to learn and you are looking to develop and grow
Fluent in Dutch and/or French and English
Your school can provide a certificate confirming that this internship is a substantial part of your education


What we offer


Reimbursement of transportation costs and daily food allowance
Continuous learning
Huge growth potential
Full support and guidance of a team of Data Analytics professionals
Valuable professional experience in the ‘best business school in the world’
The opportunity to start a career with PwC
And much more!


Looking for an internship where you’ll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!

title: Insights Analyst
description:
Job Title - Insights Analyst
Reports Into - Insights Manager
Location - Remote/Anywhere




A Little Bit About Kwalee….

Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Airport Security, and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade, and Scathe.




What’s In It For You?

We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit-sharing scheme from day 1 of employment
Creative Wednesdays! (Pitch and make your own games every Wednesday)
Great work-life balance with flexible working hours
Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!
Monthly employee awards




Are You Up To The Challenge?

As an Insights Researcher, you’ll be planning and carrying out player research to help guide our games.




Your Team Mates

The Casual Games team is a global crew whose passion for our products drive us to craft first-class gaming experiences the best we can. This goes double for gameplay, aesthetics, and marketing. We're entrepreneurial in spirit and have a collaborative mindset, so your voice is always heard.




What Does The Job Actually Involve?

Plan and conduct market and user research activities for stakeholders across the company.
Manage relationships with key products stakeholders, creating a research roadmap to run alongside product development
Plan and suggest research to support product development, all the way through the product lifecycle, from idea to hard launch and beyond
Identify research opportunities that will impact player understanding, product design, and quality
Use a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methodologies to answer the questions proposed by stakeholders
Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Digital Marketing to support broader analytics and insights work that drive business impact




Your Hard Skills

3+ years of relevant job experience working in areas of consumer research
Experience in the interactive entertainment industry (e.g., video/mobile gaming, video/entertainment platforms)
Excellent knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods
Excellent survey writing skills
Experience in data manipulation and statistical software (e.g., SPSS, R/Python or any other)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Degree in psychology, HCI, social sciences, or a related field
Effective written, storytelling, verbal, and presentation skills;
Fluent in English
A passion for gaming




Your Soft Skills

Kwalee has grown fast in recent years but we’re very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colors, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders, and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues.




We don’t like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together. If that sounds like you, then please apply.




A Little More About Kwalee

Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts.

Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle.




We have an amazing team of experts collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Lisbon, Bangalore, and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, Cyprus, the Philippines, and many more places around the world. We’ve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales, which is based in France.

We have a truly global team making games for a global audience, and it’s paying off: - Kwalee has been voted the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership Team at the TIGA Awards (Independent Game Developers’ Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth - including Antarctica!

Show more Show less

title: Business & Data Analyst
description:
The Role




As Business & Data Analyst in the VI Core Team, you will collaboratively work with the entire team as well as stakeholders to help set the right objectives, enable informed and data-driven decisions, define business logic and monitor progress.

Visual Intelligence (VI) is Solera’s market-leading automated damage detection solution driven by state-of-the-art computer vision technology. The VI Core Team is the self-sufficient team that owns the AI technology behind VI and exposes it to its clients via a RESTful API. In addition to VI the team owns and develops ML components for other Solera products such as an invoice checking solution for the property claims space.







What You’ll Do




Understand business requirements, system capabilities, and the metrics that drive the value for the users of VI
Collaborate with the team and with stakeholders on behalf of the team to align around objectives, roadmap as well as issues, and opportunities
Contribute to - and potentially own some of - the teams processes and operations
Help manage the backlog, create tickets, and specify acceptance criteria
Own the teams internal and external documentation for business and tech audiences
Perform strategic and ad-hoc data analyses in support of the team's mission
Develop reports and dashboards and define metrics that inform success for the team
Explore large, complex, and loosely defined datasets to identify problems and create actionable insights
Operate with an iterative mindset, focused on guiding the team to delivering incremental value at high velocity
Drive long-term and company-wide initiatives to improve the quality of the data available to the team







What You’ll Bring




3+ years experience in business analysis role in cross-functional agile software delivery team, data analysis with large and complex data sets and data science/engineering, software development, or technical writing roles
Very strong analytical skills
Strong communication skills in English with proven ability to listen and understand technical language, to describe complex problems and solutions efficiently and effectively both in writing and verbally as well as to effectively communicate to different audiences
Experience in negotiating scope and priorities and balancing them for successful outcomes
Experience leveraging descriptive data techniques
Experience uncovering data insights to form hypotheses, designing product experiments, evaluating results and making recommendations
Advanced Level SQL
Ability to thrive in a fully remote organization, being transparent and highly collaborative




Nice to have:
Ability to write code to solve and automate tasks
Familiarity with any of the technologies listed above
Familiarity with reactjs, nextjs or similar web frameworks

Show more Show less

title: Data Functional Analyst & BI Developer
description:
ARHS Digital is looking for a Data Functional Analyst & BI Developer to join a new team of one of its clients in Brussels, a key player in the Belgian social security sector.




The Data Functional Analyst & Architect plays a key role in the requirements gathering and the data modelling of data analytics solutions (data warehouses, data marts) and/or development of data solutions, including regular contact with the Business to understand business needs and translate them into data & technical requirements.




Role & Responsibilities

Facilitate and conduct interviews with business end users to determine functional and non-functional requirements for BI solutions.
Translate business needs into logical and physical data models with appropriate documentation.
Work with the data architect to translate requirements into functional and technical specifications
Design, build, deploy and maintain the BI solutions according to established standards (data integration, data warehouse, data marts) in accordance with the functional and non-functional requirements (performance, data volume).
Test the analytics solution, conduct troubleshooting, provide maintenance and adequate technical documentation.
Create visualizations and reports for requested projects in Power BI or SSRS.
Conduct prototype reviews and demo’s including training on the data model to the business users.
Works with the Project Leader along the entire project lifecycle to ensure appropriate delivery in an agile and pragmatic approach




Qualifications

Your Profile

Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
Strong conceptual thinking and technical skills.
Proactive with a pragmatic approach and delivery focus
Analytical mind with a problem-solving, pragmatic aptitude.
Team player; able to work collaboratively within a transversal organization
Ability to translate business needs into working solutions.
Perseverant & stress resistant
Open-minded & willing to learn




Technical Skills

Minimum 3 years of experience in data functional analysis and BI development in the Microsoft BI stack (including SSIS / SSAS).
Ability to translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications.
Strong data modelling experience (logical and physical modelling).
Good experience in data warehouse design (Kimball dimensional modelling).
Very good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (from a development perspective), SQL queries, T-SQL
Good understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL framework.
Experience in visualization and reporting tools such as Microsoft Power BI and SSRS.
Experience in Master Data Management and Data Quality Management would be considered an asset
Knowledge of the following tools would be considered an asset : modelling tool (e.g. Enterprise Architect), Azure data analytics tools (Azure data factory, Databricks,…)




Additional Information

Don’t hesitate! Join our team




What you’ll get:

An informal hierarchy and work environment:

Our open, flat structure supports a strong focus on communication and collaboration, enabling to respond quickly to market changes and customer requests.




An attractive salary package:

With an attractive salary and benefits package – including advantageous fringe benefits – you’ll be paid for what you love to do.




A strong corporate culture:

You’ll join a dynamic team of smart and ambitious people. From the way we hire to the way we relate to our clients – our values form the foundation of the way we work.




Learning & development opportunities:

We constantly invest in our people and are committed to providing individual development opportunities to help you continue to grow and stay happy and satisfied at work.




Exciting projects:

You’ll take ownership of various projects for both public and private clients: calling for creativity and innovation, at the cutting-edge of technology.




A rock-solid company:

With more than 200 customers, and 30% turnover growth in FY2021, you’ll join a business with a sustainable and growth-oriented plan.




But let’s talk about it face to face!




You have the qualities listed above? Please, send us your CV, which will be processed in full confidentiality.

You don’t have all the above requirements but own a great part of them? You can send us your CV too because we will give you the opportunity to grow with us.

ARHS Digital is looking for a Data Functional Analyst & BI Developer to join a new team of one of its clients in Brussels, a key player in the Belgian social security sector.


The Data Functional Analyst & Architect plays a key role in the requirements gathering and the data modelling of data analytics solutions (data warehouses, data marts) and/or development of data solutions, including regular contact with the Business to understand business needs and translate them into data & technical requirements.


Role & Responsibilities

  • Facilitate and conduct interviews with business end users to determine functional and non-functional requirements for BI solutions.
  • Translate business needs into logical and physical data models with appropriate documentation.
  • Work with the data architect to translate requirements into functional and technical specifications
  • Design, build, deploy and maintain the BI solutions according to established standards (data integration, data warehouse, data marts) in accordance with the functional and non-functional requirements (performance, data volume).
  • Test the analytics solution, conduct troubleshooting, provide maintenance and adequate technical documentation.
  • Create visualizations and reports for requested projects in Power BI or SSRS.

title: Finance Data Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Finance Data Analyst to join the Cost Controlling team of 10 people. This team is part of the Strategic Planning & Controlling department within the financial business unit of AXA Belgium (insurance).




The Cost Controlling team is responsible for budgeting, monitoring and prognosis (in both short and long term) of the general costs of AXA Belgium and the allocation of these costs to the products. In addition, this department advises AXA Belgium during the selection of projects that must allow the ambitions (concerning costs) to be achieved and monitors these projects financially.




As Financial Data Analyst within this team, you will perform the following activities:




Manage the tools of Finance (Anaplan, Power Bl, etc.) for the proper performance of all tasks undertaken by the Cost Controlling Team;
Support the team by creating (new) financial reports to help achieve objectives;
Collect, check, consolidate, develop analyses and make recommendations for the purpose of assisting management in taking strategic decisions;
Analyse, define, organise and connect expenses data;
Use his/her expertise in the process of data processing in order to identify and analyse the impact of transversal projects on the data processing;
Contribute to the implementation of projects and the continuous improvement of Finance's reporting processes by gathering and reviewing needs as needed;
Be responsible for the processes regarding the annual budget round and quarterly forecasts;
Align the output of the budget round and forecasts with the strategic planning.




As contact point and Finance business partner, you will frequently interact with:

The members of the expenses team
The other Finance teams (Accounting, Finance Support, Value Management, etc.)
The other Business Units
AXA Group




Do we have a match?




3 to 5 years' experience in a similar position in cost controlling or financial analysis and reporting
Master in economy, finances or sciences
Experience with Data Management and affinity with Tooling & Reporting
Excellent analysis capacity, accuracy and critical faculty
Eager for initiative and proactivity in the work
Able to work both independently and under pressure
Team player
Excellent communication skills, both in word and writing
Perfect knowledge of French or Dutch, active knowledge of the other national language and of English
Knowledge of Anaplan and/or Power BI.
Thorough knowledge of MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint).




If yes, apply now!

title: Marketing Data Analist
description:
Ben je op zoek naar een functie als Data Analist met de focus op Marketing strategie? Heb je sterke interesse om met data te werken op functioneel niveau en binnen verschillende marketing campagnes? Kom je het liefst terecht in een jong en dynamisch team waarin autonomie centraal staat? Lees dan zeker verder want deze vacature is echt iets voor jou!




Je komt terecht in een flexibele omgeving (50% thuiswerk) met glijdende uren en tal van andere voordelen.




Functie




Als Marketing Data Analist kom je terecht in een gedreven "digitale cel" team en rapporteer je aan je rechtstreekse collega van dit team. Dit team is onder andere verantwoordelijk voor de analyse op de verschillende marketing campagnes, alsook voor de rapportering hiervan. Zo zal je onder meer de brug maken tussen marketing en IT. Je moet dashboards kunnen lezen, analytisch ingesteld zijn en analyse voeren op bv. website bezoekers.




Jouw functie bestaat voornamelijk uit




Uitvoeren van analyses op het gedrag van de website bezoekers, de sociale media kanalen, email campagnes,... en deze vertalen naar een toegankelijke taal waar marketing mee aan de slag kan.
Optimaliseren van de UX en hier gerichte campagnes verder uit opzetten.
Adviseren van de nodige aanpassingen in de wekelijkse business unit meetings.
Leiden van verschillende marketing campagnes en de juiste doelgroepen stellen.




Profiel




Je hebt minimum een eerste relevante ervaring of hebt een bachelor studie binnen Marketing achter de rug.
Je hebt een passie voor data analyse en enige kennis van Google ADS & Google Analitics.
Je hebt kennis van Keyfinder, Hotjar en Mailcampagnes.
Je kan rapporten lezen, bij voorkeur met Power BI.




What's in it for you?




Je ontvangt een mooi salaris aangevuld met maaltijdcheques, groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, 32 verlofdagen, mobiliteitsbudget,...
Je krijgt de kans om veelzijdige taken uit te voeren en ervaring op te bouwen binnen een open en positieve sfeer.
Je maakt deel uit van een tof team van gedreven collega's waarbij iedereen heel aanspreekbaar is en er een go forward mentaliteit heerst.




Contact




Ben je op zoek naar een functie als Marketing data analist? Reageer dan nu en stuur je CV via onderstaande knop.
