GoHenry is a London and New York-based fintech company that pioneered the youth fintech and financial education category. We are on a mission to make every kid smart with money and to delight our community of 2 million parents, kids, and teens with innovative, market-leading tools to help parents raise financially healthy kids.

GoHenry offers a debit card and app for kids and teens and companion apps for the family, with in-app tools for sending money, automating allowance, managing chores, setting savings goals, giving to charity, and in-app financial education lessons where kids can watch videos, take quizzes and earn points & badges. This is all designed to help kids and teens build good money habits that will last a lifetime.

The Tech team at GoHenry is looking to recruit a Mid-Level Data Analyst to closely work with the Growth Product teams and other areas in the business. We are a rapidly growing fintech company and are looking for a self starter looking to make an immediate impact across the business. The successful candidate will leverage their business knowledge and technical skills to develop analysis and reporting capabilities to extract, deliver, and present data insights. These will be used to measure the impact of new initiatives, product improvements and overall company OKRs. The role will report to the Growth Analytics and Strategy Lead, while also working closely with the Onboarding PM and their team.

What You Will Do
  • Work with the Growth Product team to understand, document, and conduct relevant analysis
  • Present findings to high level stakeholders on a regular basis
  • Perform in depth data analysis to identify and understand anomalies
  • Use creative thinking to identify new tests to run, and new ways to measure results
  • Analyze, interpret, and extract results from various data sources
  • Build and maintain KPI reporting
  • Analyze and evaluate results of A/B tests, providing plans of action based on the measured results
  • Work across different stacks to ensure that you have a holistic knowledge of the Growth funnel and how it impacts the business as a whole
  • Use your knowledge of the business to identify areas of opportunity for growth and measurement

What We Are Looking For
  • At least 2-3 years work experience as a Data Analyst
  • Very strong knowledge of SQL
  • Self-motivated individual
  • Demonstrable experience working with Python
  • Experienced in B2C business, signup funnels, A/B testing, and analytic platforms
  • Experienced in creating and delivering reports/dashboards using tools such as Google Data Studio, Looker or others
  • Highly proficient in Excel or Google Sheets
  • Bachelor’s degree in STEM field, or relevant bootcamp course

Nice-to-have Skills
  • Looker/LookML
  • Experience working in a B2C Fintech business
  • Google Analytics
  • dbt
  • Airflow

Benefits
  • goFlex - flexible working that lets you choose how (& where) you work best (office / home / a mix of both)
  • 33 days of holiday (including public holidays)
  • An additional birthday day off
  • Family-friendly leave policies
  • Enhanced maternity and paternity leave
  • Westfield Cash Health Plan (for you and your children)
  • Westfield surgery plan after 3 years’ service
  • Westfield Rewards (receive discounts at over 600 retailers)
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Training opportunities to further develop your craft
  • Choose your own equipment

We are proud to say...
  • We help over two million members improve their money skills every single day.
  • We are one of Tech Track’s top 50 fastest growing UK companies.
  • We were nominated for ‘Best Personal Finance App’ at the British Bank Awards 2020.
  • We were voted 'Best Children's Financial Provider' at the British Bank Awards 2021.
  • Our kids and parents have donated over £200,000 of their own money to NSPCC via their GoHenry accounts.
  • We won the Kids' Cards category of Finder's Customer Satisfaction Awards 2022.

GoHenry is an equal-opportunity employer, and we are on a mission to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace. Individuals seeking employment at GoHenry are considered without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Want to join our mission?

If GoHenry sounds like a place you would like to be, please apply using the link below.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
Junior Data Analyst– Permanent

Location: Central London




The client

A think-tank who are committed to creating poverty indexes to help governments create policies.




Your responsibilities

Quality assurance of the raw data underpinning them, and how they contribute to the growth of Prosperity.
Improving data sources and methodology to ensure the U.S. Index is World class.
Draw out key findings from the Index and augment with research creating insight to drive change.
Conduct robust analysis using appropriate methodology and tools such as Python (pandas) to derive new insights (training will be provided in Python).z
In light of findings, assemble conclusions, including via oral presentations and in written format, ensuring that the outputs are effectively communicated to non-technical audiences, to drive maximum value from our data assets




Your experience

Highly numerate, with a degree with a significant quantitative component (i.e., Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Social Research)
Confident in manipulating data within Excel
A demonstrable interest in data analysis and public policy, and/or social and economic affairs
A strong attention to detail: Ensures accuracy, quality and process control
Communication: An ability to present problem statements, concepts and conclusions to a variety of internal and external stakeholders through reports, presentations and other written output
Highly organised and able to prioritise personal tasks and meet deadlines
A team player who works collaboratively, establishes rapport easily




What’s next?

If you believe you have the desired skills and experience, please follow the link to apply and attach a copy of your latest CV. If successful, a Consultant will be in touch to discuss in more detail.

title: Data Analyst - Graduate
description:
A data analyst collects, organises and studies data to provide business insight. In this role, you will: apply tools and techniques for data analysis and data visualisation (including the use of business information tools) identify, collect and migrate data to and from a range of systems.

You will look at how the company operates – conducting research and analysing data to develop their knowledge – and suggest methods for the company to improve their practices and processes. This is usually done with the aim of helping the company to make more money, solve existing business problems and/or better achieve their goals. When a company identifies an issue that they’d like to fix, you will look deeply into the situation.

You will hold discussions with all stakeholders, including anyone in the company who is affected by a business problem, such as an HR team, or business unit manager. You will then ensure an in-depth understanding of the requirements and then suggest the appropriate solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Understanding business needs as they relate to a potential change or transformation.
Gathering, identifying and documenting business requirements.
Explaining technical jargon to non-technical/commercial teams.
Simplifying requirements, so they are easily understood across the whole team.
Business process modelling and improving business processes.
Identifying costs and business savings.
Implementing, testing and deploying solutions to business problems.
Supporting business transition and helping to establish change.
Creating functional specifications for new systems and processes.
Acting as an advisor to senior managers and executive teams.
Understanding why change is required in the business.
Assisting with change management processes and procedures.
Delivering and supporting the implementation of projects.
Scoping and configuring bespoke solutions to specific problems.
Analysing the impact of business decisions, such as the need for a new IT system.
Providing support to senior business analysts.


Requirements

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to talk and present to a range of audiences, sometimes acting as a translator between parties
The capacity to motivate others and lead change
The ability to work under pressure on multiple projects within your project timeframes
A passion for creating solutions with a positive attitude to change
Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
A strong interest in business and business development
A good understanding of information technology.
Commercial awareness.
Time management and organisational skills.
Problem-solving skills.
Analytical skills.
Leadership and management skills.
An interest in, and understanding of, project management techniques and computing systems.
Show more Show less

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
Junior Data Analyst– Permanent

Location: Central London

Up to £35,000 per annum




The client

A think-tank who are committed to creating poverty indexes to help governments create policies.




Your responsibilities

Develop and maintain knowledge and expertise in microsimulation of poverty impacts.




Use survey data to create analyses of UK poverty, including the nature and lived experience of poverty in the UK.




Use the microsimulation model to produce a large number of assessments of policy impacts, ensuring these are statistically and economically robust, and appropriately reflect the inherent uncertainties involved.




Build knowledge and expertise on key aspect of poverty measurement and the drivers of poverty reduction.




Use results to create impactful written materials that meet the needs of a range of audiences, including summaries for senior management and detailed reports for more technical audiences.




Your experience

Strong data manipulation and analytical skills, ideally rooted in a quantitative degree or field.




Experience with Python or R. Some experience with the os and subprocess modules (or analogues in R) would be desirable.




Knowledge of – or interest in – policy issues related to relative poverty and low-income.




Experience in handling and manipulating large datasets, including UK household surveys (e.g. Family Resources Survey, Understanding Society, Labour Force Survey).




Some experience with Stata/SPSS/SAS is desirable.




Experience in producing high quality analysis in written and presentation form.




Some experience using git for version control would be desirable.




Excellent general IT skills with experience of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) is essential.




What’s next?

If you believe you have the desired skills and experience, please follow the link to apply and attach a copy of your latest CV. If successful, a Consultant will be in touch to discuss in more detail.

title: Data Analyst
description:
DATA ANALYST

When you look at L’Oréal, what do you see? If all you see is lipstick, look again and experience the Freedom to go Beyond the ordinary. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal. We operate in 150 countries on 5 continents. With 36 international brands and 86,000 employees worldwide, we’re well on our way to fulfilling our common purpose: to create beauty that moves the world.

By 2030 we want to capture over another 1 billion consumers around the world. How? By creating cosmetic products which meet the infinite diversity of consumers beauty needs and desires, and always through digital innovation. Not only that, but taking our sustainability goals seriously; moving us to a more inclusive and sustainable society, for every generation.

Our brands, dynamic culture, and always being our own challenger mean that we offer freedom and opportunity you won’t get anywhere else.

If you want the Freedom to go Beyond, we’ll see you at L’Oréal.

Our Corporate Division supports the 4000+ strong workforce in L’Oréal UK & Ireland. It’s a fast-paced and dynamic environment when you’ll have visibility over our 4 Divisions and play an integral role in moving our business forward. The Ecommerce Acceleration Team exists to make L’Oreal UKI a digital first business by 2024 and drive market share across all our brands and divisions.

We embrace our entrepreneurial spirit in everything we do, always challenging ourselves to new ways of doing things. That means looking for innovative solutions, sustainable developments, and having the freedom to go beyond the ordinary.

Our founder Eugène Schueller once said that “a company is not walls and machines, it’s people, people, people”. Joining our corporate teams means joining the world leader in beauty, at the cutting edge of innovation. But above all, it means becoming part of a team of talented and inspiring people.

You will

Define and steer data quality improvement plan for all data regarding A&P and Promo

>define new templates

>Review the improvement roadmap implementation with key stakeholders: data owners within all divisions of the UKI and Global Data PO

Collect and transform Data

>Test, implement and upgrade a Semi-automation process for collection and transformation of our manual A&P data

>Lead the collection of all data regarding A&P management and required for MMMs across the UKI

>Manage and extract in autonomy media data from the Essence Data Platform and other sources:

Define the right extraction parameters
Give feedback to the EDDS via the Global PO

>Give feedback to local providers on corrections that should be applied at sourcing data

Automate Data sourcing

>Upgrade data sourcing and support central data automation

Define local data governance
Identify local data assets per domain (sell out, O+O)
Define owners depending on levers, domains, and tools
Increase data availability and literacy

You have

The ability to make appropriate decisions when supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products
Knowledge of data management and business knowledge – particularly media to be able to translate and apply data driven solutions
The ability to build processes supporting data transformation, data structures and dependency
The ability to coordinate data collection across different teams and sources
Highly numerate, analytically strong and a great eye for detail
Power BI, DAX, Advanced Excel, VBA (essential)
GCP, SQL, Google Cloud Platform, Python (desirable)
Strong organisational skills
Experience of agile project management and strong organizational skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

You are

Demonstrates entrepreneurship
Manages Complexity
Achieves results with integrity
Acts/Leads with human sensitivity
Displays sensitivity to the métier
Interacts effectively
Innovates

You get

We put people development and learning at the heart of our business; we’ll help you master your role, develop your technical expertise and you’ll benefit from exceptional management and leadership programmes. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, you’re actively encouraged to embed learning into your daily life and are rewarded for continuous improvement. Don’t forget that every employee gets 3 Coursera credits; that means you can get qualifications from over 1000 universities from around the world, with thousands of courses to choose from.

Looking for a good work/life balance? With our new hybrid working scheme, you can take a flexible approach to work as well as benefit from early finishes on Fridays during the summer...so you can enjoy more time with your friends and family.

As any great employer should do, we make sure we look after your financial wellbeing. That’s why we have a great pension plan, profit share scheme and many more incentives to give you the security you deserve. We also put employee health and wellbeing at the front of everything we do; fully training employees as mental health ambassadors to support and educate ourselves further. There’s also the chance to enrol in medical and dental insurance, gym discounts, health check-ups and even yoga and Pilates classes to employees in all of our locations.

Oh, did we mention that as an employee you also get discount sales of up to 70% off throughout the year on our 36 brands? Plus, you also get the option to share that in our Friends and Family sales as well!

How we recruit

At L’Oréal, we take pride in creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where everyone is welcome and their contributions are valued. When we recruit, hire, train, promote or engage in any other employment practice, we are committed to being an inclusive employer regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, socioeconomic status, medical condition or disability, or any other protected status. When we look for talent, we welcome difference - different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and perspectives. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal.
Show more Show less

  • Experience of agile project management and strong organizational skills
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
You are
  • Demonstrates entrepreneurship
  • Manages Complexity
  • Achieves results with integrity
  • Acts/Leads with human sensitivity
  • Displays sensitivity to the métier
  • Interacts effectively
  • Innovates
You get

We put people development and learning at the heart of our business; we’ll help you master your role, develop your technical expertise and you’ll benefit from exceptional management and leadership programmes. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, you’re actively encouraged to embed learning into your daily life and are rewarded for continuous improvement. Don’t forget that every employee gets 3 Coursera credits; that means you can get qualifications from over 1000 universities from around the world, with thousands of courses to choose from.

Looking for a good work/life balance? With our new hybrid working scheme, you can take a flexible approach to work as well as benefit from early finishes on Fridays during the summer...so you can enjoy more time with your friends and family.

As any great employer should do, we make sure we look after your financial wellbeing. That’s why we have a great pension plan, profit share scheme and many more incentives to give you the security you deserve. We also put employee health and wellbeing at the front of everything we do; fully training employees as mental health ambassadors to support and educate ourselves further. There’s also the chance to enrol in medical and dental insurance, gym discounts, health check-ups and even yoga and Pilates classes to employees in all of our locations.

Oh, did we mention that as an employee you also get discount sales of up to 70% off throughout the year on our 36 brands? Plus, you also get the option to share that in our Friends and Family sales as well!

How we recruit

At L’Oréal, we take pride in creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where everyone is welcome and their contributions are valued. When we recruit, hire, train, promote or engage in any other employment practice, we are committed to being an inclusive employer regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, socioeconomic status, medical condition or disability, or any other protected status. When we look for talent, we welcome difference - different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and perspectives. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: London

Salary: Up to £70,000 DOE + bonus + company benefits




Forsyth Barnes are excited to be partnered with a fast growing cosmetics company. You will support the team with new product Incubator and Integration function. In this role, you will support the everyone within the business with data insights on the effectiveness of new products as well as quantitative market and competitor analytics. You will work closely with the founders and be a crucial part of the wider business.




Key Responsibilties:




You’ll deliver market and competitive analysis on the cosmetic market and drive product development as well as potential M&A activity within the industry.
You’ll own the entire analytics lifecycle - from opportunity / problem definition to discovery, analysis and data product development.
You’ll build data pipelines or formulate requirements for data engineers.
You’ll support the corporate development function around M&A all the way from sourcing to due diligence and integration.
You’ll drive a culture of data storytelling across the business and the wider analytics department.




Key Requirements:




Numerical/Analytical minded (degree in a numerical subject is ideal).
Minimum 2 years of experience as a data analyst.
Proficient in SQL or Python.
Experience with dashboarding/reporting tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.
Excellent stakeholder and time management skills.
Experience with owning multiple projects from start to finish.




If you’re interested, please apply by emailing a copy of your most up to date CV and your current availability.




Please feel free to pass this on to anyone you think it may suit/ anyone you know may be interested.




Apologies if this is not wholly relevant, or at the desire level. Please feel free to view all of our jobs at www.forsythbarnes.com

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
This is a great opportunity for someone interested in data visualisation & web development to use and develop their skills to help tackle climate change. We are looking for candidates with fundamental coding skills and with a strong interest in building interactive and accessible data visualisations.

New AutoMotive is a not-for-profit transport research organisation with a mission to accelerate and support the transition to electric vehicles. We use vehicle data to show consumers how they can benefit from the EV transition and to help shape and influence policy to promote EVs. We are currently developing products that unlock the data to help people plan the transition to electric vehicles - a key part of the UK’s transition to net zero carbon emissions.

Requirements

Duties will include:

Developing tools for consumers to navigate the transition to EVs
Building dashboards and portals for people to access data
Helping process and store data
Facilitating the development of data visualisations and tools to make data accessible to a wider audience
Assisting with the production of digital products
Contributing to the creation of documentation and writing up methodologies
Other duties as required.


Skills and experience:

Essential

Familiarity with a programming language (ideally JavaScript)
Experience in working with large datasets
Willingness to learn


Desirable

Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g. python, SQL, R)
Basic knowledge of Git and GitHub
Scientific background (i.e. maths, physics, statistics)


You’ll be a key part of New AutoMotive’s growing data team, and have the opportunity to get involved with work that helps shape and influence public policy. We’re committed to training & skills - if you want to develop your coding skills then we will support you to do so. No prior professional experience is required, and recent graduates are encouraged to apply.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Function:

Business Intelligence and Data Science

Closing Date:

27/01/2023

As a Data Analyst you will deliver insights covering usage and content consumption across Virgin Media's multiple platforms across the business.

You'll effectively communicate strategic insights to support informed decision making with respect to product development, content acquisition, optimisation of in-life activity, or short/long-term commercial strategy whilst ensuring key measurement and data assets are fit for purpose.

Who we are

At Virgin Media, we believe that great employee experience leads to great customer experience. From our CEO to our field engineers, we are committed to growing a diverse and inclusive culture that empowers innovation, thus achieving our purpose of “Building connections that really matter” and our North Star “To become the most recommended brand by our people and customers”.

We're going All In, to remove bias and barriers for our people and our candidates. We're working hard to achieve bold ambitions, to help us better represent the diverse communities we serve across the UK. As an equal opportunities employer, we support and encourage you, to be your authentic self throughout your application journey.

The must haves

In order to be considered, you must have the following experience;

Strong data manipulation skills with core competency in SQL and proficiency in at least one statistical language (eg. SAS, R, etc)
Understanding of the application of statistics and statistical modelling techniques such as linear and logistic regression
Understanding of relational databases
Strong Excel skills


The other stuff we're looking for

We'd also love you to bring;

Degree in numerate discipline, ideally with postgraduate qualification in Statistics, Operational Research, Management Science or similar.
Understanding of cutting edge viewing technologies and services (eg. Virgin TV Go/Control, Netflix, Sky Go, Amazon Prime, Now TV, etc)
Recent knowledge of modern analytical tools (eg. Google Cloud Platform, Adobe Analytics, etc)


What's in it for you?

We know that benefits mean so much more than the 'stuff' we can give you, so we offer a wide range of support, rewards and tools - all focused on helping you to prioritise what really matters.

All work and no play just isn't our style! We're already planning our future ways of working, for when life becomes a little more normal again. We're constantly evolving our approach to enable you to find a great work life balance.

Next steps

If we feel like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two stage interview process.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you. Thanks for your patience in the meantime and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to join our team. If you are a compassionate, dedicated, and curious individual with excellent organizational skills, a self-motivated nature, and a passion for producing high-quality solutions, we want to hear from you - regardless of your level of experience. As a Junior Data Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work with large data sets, analyze trends, create reports, and provide insights to help the organization make better decisions.




We are looking for candidates who possess the following qualifications:




A 2:1 degree in a field related to data analysis, statistics, mathematics or computer science (preferred, but not required)
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively
A love for problem-solving and the ability to make sense of complex data
Proficiency in tools such as Excel, Python, R or SQL (preferred, but not required)




Benefits




Health insurance
Pension Plan
Flexible work schedules
Professional development opportunities
Employee wellness programs (e.g. gym memberships, on-site fitness classes)
Generous holiday and time off policies
Employee discounts and perks (e.g. discounted products or services, tickets to local events)

New London HR is a leading recruitment firm, and our clients will be viewing the applications for this role. Don't miss this chance to take the next step in your career. To apply, follow the steps outlined by New London HR. Upon completion of the virtual job specification, you will be able to negotiate salary, location, and company preferences.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Function:

Business Intelligence and Data Science

Closing Date:

27/01/2023

The Advanced Analytics and Data Science team are on a mission to create digital products that our customers love. We also want to ensure our products deliver to customer expectations and understand where our network falls short of customer expectations.

You’ll be using big data analysis techniques to understand which parts of our customer journey are driving customer pain. This will be used to form recommendations that directly support commercial decisions and digital product strategy. Success will reduce customer call centre contact rates, improve digital product engagement and drive customer recommendations for Virgin Media products and services.

Our digital products cover the full range of customer journeys from acquisition, via customer care through to renewal and retention. Through all stages we are seeking to give the most value to our customers in order to become the most recommended brand and maximise our customer lifetime value.

Within the Advanced Analytics and Data Science team you will champion customer voice and help us to foster a culture with a customer focus.

Who we are

At Virgin Media O2 we're going All In, to remove bias and barriers for our people and our candidates. We're working hard to achieve bold ambitions, to help us better represent the diverse communities we serve across the UK. As an equal opportunities employer, we support and encourage you, to be your authentic self throughout your application journey.

The must haves

In order to be considered, you must have the following experience;

Advanced SQL skills, highly competent in merging, managing, interrogating, and extracting data to supply tailored outputs.
Able to visualise and present data with clarity, particularly for less technical audiences
Enthusiastic about using data to solve problems and engages others to see the benefit of your work


The other stuff we're looking for

We'd also love you to bring experience with;

Google BigQuery
Google Analytics / Tag Manager
R or Python for data analysis


What's in it for you?

We know that benefits mean so much more than the 'stuff' we can give you, so we offer a wide range of support, rewards and tools - all focused on helping you to prioritise what really matters.

All work and no play just isn't our style! We're already planning our future ways of working, for when life becomes a little more normal again. We're constantly evolving our approach to enable you to find a great work life balance.

Next steps

If we feel like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two stage technical interview process.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you. Thanks for your patience in the meantime and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Description

As Data Analyst with PowerBi Reporting experience, you’ll deliver data/analytical solutions across the complex Heathrow environment. Building strong relationships with other business areas to understand business needs, you’ll develop and deliver data/analytics projects to improve efficiency, quality, service and value. Working with historical data and future forecasts, you’ll use agile principles to manage tasks, analytical requirements, and the build of reporting tools/models. You’ll combine datasets to provide enriched visualisations and analytical solutions.

Your role will involve:

Delivering analytical solutions and Business Intelligence tools such as reports and dashboards
Designing metrics, simplify data querying and visualise insights, maintain data updates
Timely project delivery from inception to deployment, ensuring effective integration of solutions into the operation
Combining datasets to drive meaningful outputs including ad-hoc deep dive analytics and qualitative & quantitative analysis


These skills are essential:

Experience with PowerBi Reporting/DAX is essential. As is experience in Data Visualisation.
Comfortable and confident with data and highly analytical.
Proven track record of delivery using formal analytics tools and techniques
Critical to this role is the ability to problem solve, motivation to make a big impact on our business through simplicity and an ability to work to tight deadlines.
Experience in programming languages (R or Python)


Ideally, you'll also have:

Experience with Power Apps is highly desirable
Expertise in Data Wrangling, Data Storytelling, Machine learning and Data Mining.
Performance reporting, KPI definition, and balanced scorecards
Experience of communicating complex data to analytical and non-analytical audiences
Experience in or desire to learn data modelling, DAX, M Language, Power Platform, VBA
Understanding of the complex airport operation with an appreciation for its interdependencies


About Us

Heathrow brings the world closer together. Our airport facilitates the global travel and trade that keeps the economy moving. It’s a place like no other – a city within a city – where colleagues connect around a common goal, giving our passengers the best airport service in the world.

There is a world of opportunity at Heathrow. You’ll reach your full potential within our inclusive and supportive culture, whilst helping us to deliver our ambitious plans. Not only are we growing to welcome millions more passengers each year, we’re also transforming our industry. Sustainability is at the heart of Heathrow and we’re leading global efforts on decarbonisation, so that aviation continues to be a force for good in our world.

Taking the journey with us means living our values. Doing the right thing. Keeping everyone safe. Working together. Treating everyone with respect. Giving excellent service. Improving every day. Our ever-changing airport runs on teamwork and creativity. A career at Heathrow is welcoming, diverse, challenging, exciting, and rewarding.

Join Heathrow and grow your career in an airport that matters to millions.

Our rewards

We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits, along with performance-based annual bonuses, our longer-term Share in Success Bonus plans, generous annual leave allowances and market-leading pensions. With family friendly policies, access to private health insurance and a wide range of wellbeing tools, we’ll support you to be at your best inside and outside work. And we’ll provide learning and development opportunities to help you reach your full potential.

Working Location

Our agile approach offers the opportunity to combine home working with meetings, events and training at the airport. All roles involve some on-site working each week, so you’ll need to be based in the UK and within a commutable distance to Heathrow.

Sustainable Travel to work

Heathrow’s Sustainable Travel Guide sets out easy and sustainable travel options that everyone can access.

Equal Opportunities As an equal opportunities employer, we encourage applications from all. We believe that diverse talent makes us stronger – not least because we welcome passengers from all corners of the globe, every single day. Heathrow is an accessible place to work. With four diversity networks, we champion inclusivity and celebrate individuality.

Organization

At Heathrow, we’re passionate about making every journey better. That means ensuring we meet the changing needs of the passengers, colleagues and partners who use our airport. Our Solutions team encompasses project management, process improvement, business change, technology, cyber defence and procurement. It brings together the people with the skills to deliver diverse, prestigious and often large-scale projects from start to finish.

You’ll be part of a team that is shaping our airport, and the experience of countless passengers. It’s a collaborative environment, where you can rely on the support of the experts you’ll be working with every day. Whether working on the technology at the bedrock of our organisation, the commercial agreements that our operation relies on, or the infrastructure that we’re transforming every day, you’ll be taking on projects you can take pride in and feel passionate about. It’s an exciting place to be because the scale of what we do is vast. Every day will test your skills and give you the opportunity to make your mark.

Join Solutions and be an incredibly important part of our recovery, as we ramp up and welcome passengers back to the airport.

As Data Analyst with PowerBi Reporting experience, you’ll deliver data/analytical solutions across the complex Heathrow environment. Building strong relationships with other business areas to understand business needs, you’ll develop and deliver data/analytics projects to improve efficiency, quality, service and value. Working with historical data and future forecasts, you’ll use agile principles to manage tasks, analytical requirements, and the build of reporting tools/models. You’ll combine datasets to provide enriched visualisations and analytical solutions.

Your role will involve:
  • Delivering analytical solutions and Business Intelligence tools such as reports and dashboards
  • Designing metrics, simplify data querying and visualise insights, maintain data updates
  • Timely project delivery from inception to deployment, ensuring effective integration of solutions into the operation
  • Combining datasets to drive meaningful outputs including ad-hoc deep dive analytics and qualitative & quantitative analysis

These skills are essential:
  • Experience with PowerBi Reporting/DAX is essential. As is experience in Data Visualisation.
  • Comfortable and confident with data and highly analytical.
  • Proven track record of delivery using formal analytics tools and techniques
  • Critical to this role is the ability to problem solve, motivation to make a big impact on our business through simplicity and an ability to work to tight deadlines.
  • Experience in programming languages (R or Python)

Ideally, you'll also have:
  • Experience with Power Apps is highly desirable
  • Expertise in Data Wrangling, Data Storytelling, Machine learning and Data Mining.
  • Performance reporting, KPI definition, and balanced scorecards
  • Experience of communicating complex data to analytical and non-analytical audiences
  • Experience in or desire to learn data modelling, DAX, M Language, Power Platform, VBA
  • Understanding of the complex airport operation with an appreciation for its interdependencies

About Us

Heathrow brings the world closer together. Our airport facilitates the global travel and trade that keeps the economy moving. It’s a place like no other – a city within a city – where colleagues connect around a common goal, giving our passengers the best airport service in the world.

There is a world of opportunity at Heathrow. You’ll reach your full potential within our inclusive and supportive culture, whilst helping us to deliver our ambitious plans. Not only are we growing to welcome millions more passengers each year, we’re also transforming our industry. Sustainability is at the heart of Heathrow and we’re leading global efforts on decarbonisation, so that aviation continues to be a force for good in our world.

Taking the journey with us means living our values. Doing the right thing. Keeping everyone safe. Working together. Treating everyone with respect. Giving excellent service. Improving every day. Our ever-changing airport runs on teamwork and creativity. A career at Heathrow is welcoming, diverse, challenging, exciting, and rewarding.

Join Heathrow and grow your career in an airport that matters to millions.

Our rewards

We offer competitive salaries and excellent benefits, along with performance-based annual bonuses, our longer-term Share in Success Bonus plans, generous annual leave allowances and market-leading pensions. With family friendly policies, access to private health insurance and a wide range of wellbeing tools, we’ll support you to be at your best inside and outside work. And we’ll provide learning and development opportunities to help you reach your full potential.

Working Location

Our agile approach offers the opportunity to combine home working with meetings, events and training at the airport. All roles involve some on-site working each week, so you’ll need to be based in the UK and within a commutable distance to Heathrow.

Sustainable Travel to work

Heathrow’s Sustainable Travel Guide sets out easy and sustainable travel options that everyone can access.

Equal Opportunities As an equal opportunities employer, we encourage applications from all. We believe that diverse talent makes us stronger – not least because we welcome passengers from all corners of the globe, every single day. Heathrow is an accessible place to work. With four diversity networks, we champion inclusivity and celebrate individuality.

Organization

At Heathrow, we’re passionate about making every journey better. That means ensuring we meet the changing needs of the passengers, colleagues and partners who use our airport. Our Solutions team encompasses project management, process improvement, business change, technology, cyber defence and procurement. It brings together the people with the skills to deliver diverse, prestigious and often large-scale projects from start to finish.

You’ll be part of a team that is shaping our airport, and the experience of countless passengers. It’s a collaborative environment, where you can rely on the support of the experts you’ll be working with every day. Whether working on the technology at the bedrock of our organisation, the commercial agreements that our operation relies on, or the infrastructure that we’re transforming every day, you’ll be taking on projects you can take pride in and feel passionate about. It’s an exciting place to be because the scale of what we do is vast. Every day will test your skills and give you the opportunity to make your mark.

Join Solutions and be an incredibly important part of our recovery, as we ramp up and welcome passengers back to the airport.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
Are you a recent numerical graduate looking to build on your foundation experience and take the next step to become a data analyst? Do you have a passion for using data to solve problems?




If so, we would like to hear from you; we are a fintech start-up offering a rare development environment working closely with an experienced senior management team.




Opportunity




Reporting directly to the co-founders, you will join an entrepreneurial team in a driven, fast-paced environment. This role is a newly created role responsible for supporting the development and further build-out of our platform integrations which are used to acquire, clean and analyse investment data from a range of UK wealth platforms.




We can offer a challenging and constantly evolving career where you will have an impact and develop new skills and knowledge in software development or data analysis.




About The Role




We offer first-hand experience in obtaining, cleaning, transforming and analysing complex investment data with exposure to various wealth managers and other major financial services clients.




The role will include the following:




Monitoring daily data feeds and handling related data processing tasks
Supporting other developers to add new data feeds and build out API connections
Supporting design, implementation and testing of complex analysis and tax calculations
Attendance at client meetings, pitches and dealing with follow-up
Researching relevant technical issues (e.g. data processing technical solutions, new third-party API specifications and tax or performance analysis-related research)
Assisting with special projects





Additional Information




The position is based in our Soho office.




Salary & Benefits




Basic salary: c.£30,000, increasing with progression
Holiday 20 days, increasing with longevity
Axa Private Health
Pension
Discretionary Bonuses
Training / Exam support





Essential Criteria




Recently graduated or demonstrate 1-2 years of relevant experience
Strong analytical skills.
Background with mathematical and/or computer science skills will be an advantage.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python (in particular Pandas)
Unrestricted rights to work in the UK





Desirable Criteria




Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven team player who is happy to adapt to a wide range of roles and deal with clients, third-party developers, platforms and service providers;
Self-starter and able to stay focused and make decisions within the role profile while working towards tight deadlines
Independent/flexible problem-solver with the ability to cope positively with change
Familiarity with AWS an advantage





About The Company




Confidante is a start-up fintech that aims to revolutionise data integration, analysis and tax reporting for high-net-worth clients of wealth managers and accountants by simplifying workflow and reporting.




We are a former Barclays senior leadership team offering a cloud-hosted application which obtains, cleans and conforms data from a wide range of third-party financial institutions and provides wealth managers with consolidated performance, analysis and tax reporting.




Please view our website for more information about our company and philosophy.




Keywords: Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Analytics Manager, Business Intelligence Analyst, Operations Analyst, Research Analyst and Data Manager,




NO AGENCIES PLEASE




We are using Recruitment Rebellion to run and organise the response for this advert. Please do not contact us if you are a recruiter.




Candidates, please do not apply directly to us, as there is a chance your application will be missed if it does not go through the right channel.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About Us

We’re an award-winning innovative tech consultancy - a team of creative problem solvers. Since 1993 we’ve been finding better, more sustainable ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world’s leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

In the last 30 years we won several awards, including a prestigious Queen’s Award for Enterprise in the Innovation category for our Enterprise Agile delivery approach.

Operating from 26 locations across the world, we bring together teams of creative experts with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who enjoy working and learning in our collaborative and open culture and are committed to world-class delivery.

We want to continue to grow our team with people just like you!




About the Role

In the Data capability at BJSS you'll join multi-disciplinary teams with some of the brightest and best in the industry. You’ll create powerful dashboards to bring data insights to life, helping businesses make better decisions with their data.

You'll help us deliver some of the most exciting digital programmes around, for clients in a range of industries by:

Applying cross-disciplinary thinking and working collaboratively with other members of your team
Building a deep understanding of business domain and user needs and ensuring business value is unlocked as early as possible
Thinking holistically and treating data as a business service
Designing BI as centre of excellence for business data




About You

We're looking for people who will go an extra mile to understand our clients' strategic and operational challenges and help us to design and deliver innovative solutions.

You should have experience with:

Exploratory data analysis or have experience profiling and cleaning the data, using common tools in Python or SQL
Data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau or Qlik)




You should also have experience with some of the following:

Data modelling, building data dictionaries and data governance experience
Experience with cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, Azure or GCP)
Experience working with Agile methodologies




You will have:

Strong communication skills to be involved in sprint planning, backlog refinement and presenting BI back to the stakeholders.
Experience in designing visual dashboards which tell a story about the data to the business users in a well-designed and easy to follow format.




Above all you'll be passionate about unlocking the power of data to deliver business value.




Some of the Perks

Flexible benefits allowance – you choose how to spend your allowance (additional pension contributions, healthcare, dental and more)
Industry leading health and wellbeing plan - we partner with several wellbeing support functions to cater to each individual's need, including 24/7 GP services, mental health support, and other
Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)
25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Hybrid working - Our roles are not fully remote as we take pride in the tight knit communities we have created at our local offices. But we offer plenty of flexibility and you can split your time between the office, client site and WFH
Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle, and utility brands
An industry-leading referral scheme with no limits on the number of referrals
Flexible holiday buy/sell option
Electric vehicle scheme
Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles, including unlimited access to O’Reilly
Giving back – the ability to get involved nationally and regionally with partnerships to get people from diverse backgrounds into tech
You will become part of a squad with people from different areas within the business who will help you grow at BJSS
We have a busy social calendar that you can chose to join– quarterly town halls/squad nights out/weekends away with families included/office get togethers
GymFlex gym membership programme

Show more Show less

title: Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst – ETL, Power BI, Azure Data Factory – London with Hybrid working

Up to £40k base with fantastic benefits




We are working with a particularly lovely organisation based in north London who are looking for 2 talented Data Analysts to join a great team delivering business critical data focus for the overall organisation.




This specific team deliver data ETL, reporting, insight and emerging machine learning models for business-critical decision making across a very interesting division of the organisation.




This role is responsible for producing meaningful insight, enabling the organisation to be data-driven through the delivery of analytics and business intelligence solutions. The role also works closely with colleagues across the Operations Division to increase their data fluency and ability to determine which decisions need taking.




The person in this role will also work closely with our Data Community of practice, as we complete our transition from old to new data platforms.




What you will be doing….

Proactively understand business processes and collaborate with business users to identify analytic opportunities.
Deliver actionable business insights through data analysis, visualization and storytelling, and deploy business intelligence solutions that enable business users to self-serve.
Produce, document and maintain the data flows that enable best in class analyses using data from various sources.
Assist with training and developing colleagues in the use of business reporting and interpreting the data provided.
Adhere to our established validation and governance standards, working with data colleagues to validate each other’s work.
Uphold the highest standard of data quality across our data pipelines and where possible, automate the process.
Collaborate with colleagues in the Data Community and proactively contribute to the delivery of the organisational Data Strategy




What we are looking for…

Experience in building models for MS Power BI (or similar visualization tools) and creating meaningful stories with visualisations
Significant experience in the principles of ETL and confidence in design data models that blend data from various sources. We currently use Azure Data Factory, Data Studio and Power BI, having recently shifted from Alteryx and Tableau.
Understanding of the principles and use of coding languages: we currently use tSQL, DAX, Python and Data Mapping Flows Expression language
Relevant experience in managing self and working with teams to derive actionable insight from concept to delivery, through data analysis, reporting and visualization.
The ability to train and support business colleagues with data literacy, and the skills to clearly and concisely communicate both verbally and in writing.
Excellent attention to detail and the user experience of data products
Experience in applying critical thinking for problem framing and some experience of business process mapping.




This role will offer the chance to start learning more about machine learning for the right candidate.




In return there is a competitive starting salary coupled with a fantastic range of benefits and very flexible hybrid working. This is a truly lovely organisation with a great culture and scope for growth and training. Please get in touch to have an informal chat about the role.

title: Data Analyst
description_html:
Data Analyst – new role working on market-leading data for both internal and external use in leading built environment consultancy. Great culture! Hybrid working.

This built environment firm has a great culture offering excellent work life balance and an environment where you can really grow and develop.

In this Data Analyst role, you will work in a high performing data and research team. The firm is well known for market-leading research and so you will learn a great deal. This is a great role for someone who thinks really commercially. Not only will you be researching and analysing data but you will also produce content for both internal and external use.

In particular you will:

  • Collate and analyse both internal and external data;
  • Build and deploy research surveys;
  • Work on the integration of Power BI;
  • Produce content such as articles, news and updates based on your own research and analysis;
  • Work with industry and professional bodies to produce market reports;
  • Produce benchmarking papers for both internal and external use;
  • Work on specific research projects for clients;
  • Analyse tenders to produce monthly reports;
  • Manage a content pipeline;
  • Contribute content to the market team for use in webinars, client comms, videos and podcasts;
  • Become a real expert in the built environment market.

You will have excellent research and analysis skills as well as strong copywriting skills. Ideally, you will be come from a construction/built environment/real estate background or other professional services background. Experience of analysing cost data is highly desirable for this role.

If you’re interested in this role, please get in touch with Frosso Miltiadou at 07976 659 170 or email frosso@anthemconsulting.co.uk.

title: Data Analyst
description:
A central member of the EMEA Growth Operations team, the role provides business partners and senior Growth Operation colleagues with support on analysis of sales and client data, ensuring quality of data in our CRM and providing data-backed insights in support of client servicing initiatives. The team enables colleagues to bring the best of Aon to our clients!




This is a hybrid role with the flexibility to work virtually and from an Aon office.




Aon is in the business of better decisions




At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world. As an organisation, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.




What The Day Will Look Like




Sales and pipeline reporting & analytics
Proactively connecting with colleagues across the region to discuss data challenges and seek data quality updates from other teams such as country sales ops and marketing colleagues
Assisting with production of analytics and data-backed insights from different data-sources and ensuring that relevant updates are imported back into the CRM
Building and maintaining dashboards and analyses using data visualisation tools
Developing deep knowledge of data management requirements of different commercial initiatives and contributing to EMEA data strategy




How This Opportunity Is Different




This team empowers leaders to make more informed, insight driven decisions to fuel growth, and delivers advanced analytics that allow us to innovate in how we meet client needs. This role will be central in helping Aon achieve its growth objectives.




Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success




Analytical mindset and strong data management skills with experience in processing, manipulating, analysing and presenting data are essential
Ability to be consultative with strong communication skills both verbal and written. Comfortable leading groups of people in discussion
Ability to work in a team environment and demonstrate ability to form strong relationships with stakeholders of all levels of seniority whether in person, over the phone or via email
Ability to work independently with excellent workload management and able to prioritise effectively, allowing you to develop and improve our processes
A commercial interest: Able to understand the importance of serving clients, delivering profitable growth and capable of thinking globally and acting across business lines.




In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognise that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!




Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.




We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com




Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.




NB. Dependent on regional requirements, please include specific benefits where applicable and relevant accommodation criteria and enhanced equal opportunities statement.




2518483

  • Proactively connecting with colleagues across the region to discuss data challenges and seek data quality updates from other teams such as country sales ops and marketing colleagues
  • Assisting with production of analytics and data-backed insights from different data-sources and ensuring that relevant updates are imported back into the CRM
  • Building and maintaining dashboards and analyses using data visualisation tools
  • Developing deep knowledge of data management requirements of different commercial initiatives and contributing to EMEA data strategy


How This Opportunity Is Different


This team empowers leaders to make more informed, insight driven decisions to fuel growth, and delivers advanced analytics that allow us to innovate in how we meet client needs. This role will be central in helping Aon achieve its growth objectives.


Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success


  • Analytical mindset and strong data management skills with experience in processing, manipulating, analysing and presenting data are essential
  • Ability to be consultative with strong communication skills both verbal and written. Comfortable leading groups of people in discussion
  • Ability to work in a team environment and demonstrate ability to form strong relationships with stakeholders of all levels of seniority whether in person, over the phone or via email
  • Ability to work independently with excellent workload management and able to prioritise effectively, allowing you to develop and improve our processes
  • A commercial interest: Able to understand the importance of serving clients, delivering profitable growth and capable of thinking globally and acting across business lines.


In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognise that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!


Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.


We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com


Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.


NB. Dependent on regional requirements, please include specific benefits where applicable and relevant accommodation criteria and enhanced equal opportunities statement.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job Reference #




266430BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you eager to help drive a culture of continuous learning and improvement? Do you have a curious nature, and do you enjoy technology and engineering? Are you organized?




Working for the CDIO Transformation Office, we are looking for a Data Analyst to help us:





maintain and upgrade our data dashboards and reports, gathering data from diverse sources including through APIs
identify opportunities to improve, simplify and automate our processes and analytics
collect and organize information for monitoring and reviews within the Certified Engineers program
leverage technologies to support our engineering excellence initiatives
engage with colleagues at all levels to meet business requirements
provide general administrative support to the team





Your team




You will be working for the CDIO Transformation Office, focusing on the Distinguished Engineers framework, Certified Engineers program, and additional engineering excellence initiatives. You will have the opportunity to collaborate and network with engineers from across CDIO functions and regions. As an analyst, you will play a key role in supporting culture change in CDIO.




Your expertise





a university degree in an analytical field, such as engineering, computer science/ information technology or finance
hands-on experience with data analysis and data visualization
a background and understanding of common reporting tools and disciplines (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI)
strong analytical, problem-solving, and synthesizing skills
Programming skills (e.g. Python)
awareness of user experience and design principles
a proactive, detail-oriented, and methodical approach to your work
motivation and the ability to work independently and apply own initiative
strong communication skills
fluency in English





About Us




UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




How We Hire




This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?




Disclaimer / Policy Statements




UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.




Show more Show less
